channel.title: What do I need?
channel.description: I FINALLY got my Paypal activated so what do I really need for my server? Or should I get something else? I'm really just looking to make some money atm.. Any suggestions? 72$ On Paypal.

item.title: What do I need?
item.dc:creator: @Vexillum Vexillum
item.description:
@Vexillum wrote:

[quote=“imsuperman05, post:13, topic:408323”][quote author=Vexillum link=topic=509607.msg3697389#msg3697389 date=1312522385]

You don’t really need to buy anything unless you get alot of players, and want a VPS or good forums.

Don’t I need a playershare to get players?
[/quote]
FQ playershare, recruit the old way :d[/quote]

The old way? If the old way is what I think it is… The most it got me was like 20 players.

Read full topic

item.title: What do I need?
item.dc:creator: @Vexillum Vexillum
item.description:
@Vexillum wrote:

[quote=“arham 4, post:8, topic:408323”]okay, here a long post:

Also, If you haven’t portwarded try using this guide. If that doesn’t work, try downloading a port forwarding tool.

Be sure that you put your no-ip in the client and stuff then release it change it back when you released it on the web. So for example:

if I made example.no-ip.biz, I would replace my 127.0.0.1 with my no-ip account. Then, I release it on mediafire and advertise it. As soon as I put it on mediafire I put 127.0.0.1 back and then advertise. But only put 127.0.0.1 for you, the no-ip should be for the rest of the people. Though you have the source and it will connect normally with 127.0.0.1.

TIP: Always leave your sources “run” command on and your no-ip client on. It helps the connection plus the source will be open so that will mean people can get on it.

TIP: Set your battery setting to not turn off if with charger if your close the lid. Your server can be all night and your battery will e charged for the morning :).

Now, start by using this guide:

http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?topic=422596.0

following this guide:

http://the-corruptedv2.darkbb.com/t50-rsps-ultimate-beginner-guide

and following this guys tutorials:

http://www.youtube.com/user/CNNRS#p/u/5/_SK-pM-IE00

Personally, I prefer starting with a pking spawn server as you dont have to worry about skilling or alot of shops.

Also, sine those types of servers get highley popular, you an use your money for the vps. I personally suggest vpsland.com.

Good Luck,
Arham 4[/quote]

I’m not dumb… I know how to make a server and I know how to code one… I just haven’t really started a server I actually need to pay for. I am trying to make a successful server and get tips on things to buy for it. I don’t need to know how to portforward and shit… I’m not dumb.

Read full topic

item.title: What do I need?

What the hell arham, stop posting irrelevant things…

item.title: What do I need?
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

okay, here a long post:

Also, If you haven’t portwarded try using this guide. If that doesn’t work, try downloading a port forwarding tool.

Be sure that you put your no-ip in the client and stuff then release it change it back when you released it on the web. So for example:

if I made example.no-ip.biz, I would replace my 127.0.0.1 with my no-ip account. Then, I release it on mediafire and advertise it. As soon as I put it on mediafire I put 127.0.0.1 back and then advertise. But only put 127.0.0.1 for you, the no-ip should be for the rest of the people. Though you have the source and it will connect normally with 127.0.0.1.

TIP: Always leave your sources “run” command on and your no-ip client on. It helps the connection plus the source will be open so that will mean people can get on it.

TIP: Set your battery setting to not turn off if with charger if your close the lid. Your server can be all night and your battery will e charged for the morning :).

Now, start by using this guide:

http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?topic=422596.0

following this guide:

http://the-corruptedv2.darkbb.com/t50-rsps-ultimate-beginner-guide

and following this guys tutorials:

http://www.youtube.com/user/CNNRS#p/u/5/_SK-pM-IE00

Personally, I prefer starting with a pking spawn server as you dont have to worry about skilling or alot of shops.

Also, sine those types of servers get highley popular, you an use your money for the vps. I personally suggest vpsland.com.

Good Luck,
Arham 4

Read full topic
